subject: Psychology
title: The Stanford Prison Experiment
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Stanford Prison Experiment.

hook.text: College students were randomly assigned as guards or prisoners. Within days, guards became cruel. Prisoners broke down.

buildup.text: Philip Zimbardo's 1971 study simulated a prison to test whether roles shape behavior more than personality does.

discovery.text: Guards imposed humiliating rules. Prisoners became passive and depressed. The study was stopped after just six days.

twist.text: Critics argue Zimbardo coached the guards, undermining the study's validity. The debate continues decades later.

climax.text: Flawed or not, it raised a vital question: how much of our behavior is us, and how much is the role we're given?

punchline.text: Put on a uniform and the role starts wearing you.

quiz.question: How many days did the Stanford Prison Experiment last?
